articles.author: James Mackenzie, Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Samia Nakhoul
articles.description: Lebanon's Hezbollah militant group said on Friday it was moving to a new and escalating phase in its war against Israel while Iran said "the spirit of resistance will be strengthened" after the killing of Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar.
articles.title: Hezbollah says it will escalate war with Israel after Hamas leader killed

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: The Israeli military said on Friday it sent another army unit to support its forces operating in Jabalia, the largest of Gaza's eight historic refugee camps, where residents said tanks blew up roads and houses as they thrust further into the territory.
articles.title: Israel sends more troops into north Gaza, deepens raid

articles.author: Sarah Marsh, Jeff Mason
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden will on Friday seek to cement cooperation with key European partners on issues from the Ukraine war to conflict in the Middle East during a swift swansong trip to Berlin.
articles.title: Biden to discuss Ukraine with allies on swansong Berlin trip

articles.author: Gleb Bryanski, Vladimir Soldatkin
articles.description: The BRICS group will generate most of the global economic growth in the coming years thanks to its size and relatively fast growth compared with that of developed Western nations, Russian President Vladimir Putin said on Friday.
articles.title: Putin says BRICS, not the West, will drive global economic growth

articles.author: Samia Nakhoul, Tom Perry, James Mackenzie
articles.description: Israeli leaders are now seeking to lock in strategic gains and reshape the regional landscape in its favour.
articles.title: After Sinwar's death, Israel aims to lock in strategic gains before US election

articles.author: Volodymyr Pavlov, Vitalii Hnidyi
articles.description: Yuliia Baibak could not bear another Russian air strike on her neighbourhood before evacuating her parents from the besieged Ukrainian city of Kupiansk.
articles.title: Residents flee Ukraine's Kupiansk as Russia presses down on northeast hub

articles.author: George Obulutsa
articles.description: Kenya's President William Ruto has nominated interior minister Kithure Kindiki as his new deputy president, a day after the Senate voted to impeach Ruto's previous deputy Rigathi Gachagua.
articles.title: Kenya's Ruto chooses interior minister as new deputy

articles.author: Anna Mehler Paperny
articles.description: Twice since July 2022, Moninder Singh, spokesperson for a Sikh advocacy group in Canada's British Columbia province, has had police come to his door in the Vancouver suburb of Surrey.
articles.title: Warned by police, some of Canada's Sikhs feel threatened by India

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Switzerland has signed up to the European Sky Shield Initiative (ESSI), the government said on Friday, a project which seeks to build a unified air and missile defence system across Europe.
articles.title: Neutral Switzerland signs declaration to join European Sky Shield initiative

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said on Friday that he had asked the defence ministry to work on proposals for possible weapons exports.
articles.title: Ukraine to work on proposals for possible weapons exports, Zelenskiy says
